description:
Cupriavidus campinensis is a species of bacteria that belongs to the genus Cupriavidus. It is a Gram-negative, aerobic, and non-spore-forming bacterium. Cupriavidus campinensis was first isolated from a soil sample collected in Campinas, Brazil.

This species is characterized by its ability to grow at a wide range of temperatures, from 10°C to 40°C, with an optimal growth temperature around 30°C. It is also known to be resistant to heavy metals, such as copper, and can utilize a variety of organic compounds as carbon and energy sources.

Cupriavidus campinensis is a versatile bacterium that has potential applications in bioremediation and biotechnology, due to its ability to tolerate and metabolize various pollutants and its potential for producing useful biomass or metabolites.
